conclusion: Analyze motion using the velocity-time graph.
Graph shows velocity of particles A and B over time; area under curve represents displacement.
Particle A accelerates to velocity 2v0 in time t0; Particle B accelerates to velocity v0 in time 2t0.
Displacement of each particle found by calculating area under velocity-time curve.
Displacement of A from 0 to t0 is v0 t0.
Displacement of A from t0 to 2t0 is 2v0 t0.
Displacement of B from 0 to 2t0 is v0 t0.
At t = 2t0, displacement of A is 2v0 t0 and B is v0 t0; difference is v0 t0.
Difference in displacement maximized when curves diverge the most.
Maximum separation occurs when velocity of A is decreasing and B is increasing.
Particles are farthest apart at t = 3t0.
Final answer: Particles A and B are farthest apart at t = 3t0.
